Articles.Content:
So related to my last question, I am trying to build a craft using structural tube and panel However, I found the full launch stack flip. So based on the other thread on Structure tube (yes, it had a lot of drag), I switch it to fairing. However, I still have it flipping.

I realize I actually used structural panels from MH. Seeing it have nine nodes, do they have more drag then radiator panels/old structural panels?

Edited March 30, 2018 by Jestersage

In the current version, fairings have a bug which makes them have a lot of drag.

But it's easy enough just to test the structural panels and see.

So they answer is no, they are nearly the same.
